metadata.name: Untitled
metadata.description:
In this Digital Sculpture Series 
“Beyond the Matrix” Gregory Borlein 
explores with 3D Scanned everyday 
environments and a uniquely made 
soundtrack for each of them the 
Fragments of reality we percieve 
and what lies beyond it. 

We see scenes that we walk through 
ourselves but with a new 360 degree 
perspective and a soundtrack that 
makes us ponder what reality actually 
is and which meaning we give to it. 

Sometimes a different soundtrack to 
a similar scene makes a complete 
difference in how we percieve it.

The glitches that appear in the 
sculptures due to technological 
issues are welcomed, because they 
show the non fixed state of things 
and also the black background that 
surrounds them and the black spots 
that are appearing and disappearing.

While the digital sculptures are 
asking us what lies behind that which 
we can see and what it is 
that gives reality as we know it, 
the space to appear in as.


Gregory Borlein studied painting, 
digital arts and sculpture at the 
Academy of fine arts Munich and Lisbon
